com.stephentuso.welcome

Class WelcomeScreenBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stephentuso.welcome.WelcomeScreenBuilder

  • public class WelcomeScreenBuilder
extends Object
    Created by stephentuso on 11/16/15. Class that wraps a WelcomeScreenConfiguration.Parameters object and provides a convenient way to create a WelcomeScreenConfiguration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WelcomeScreenBuilder(android.content.Context context)

      Set the color to be used when no background color is specified for a page Default is colorPrimary if available (support library or lollipop+), otherwise material blue 600

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder swipeToDismiss(boolean swipeToDismiss)
        Enables or disables swipe to dismiss (disabled by default)
        Parameters:
        swipeToDismiss - True to enable swipe to dismiss, false to disable it
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • canSkip

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder canSkip(boolean canSkip)
        Sets whether or not the welcome screen can be skipped. Skipping is allowed by default
        Parameters:
        canSkip - True to allow skipping, false to disable it
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • backButtonSkips

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder backButtonSkips(boolean backButtonSkips)
        Only applies if skipping is allowed. Sets whether or not the back button can skip the welcome screen. This is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        backButtonSkips - True to allow the back button to skip the welcome screen, false to disable it
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • backButtonNavigatesPages

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder backButtonNavigatesPages(boolean navigatesPages)
        Set whether or not pressing the back button will move to the previous page in the welcome screen. This is true by default
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • animateButtons

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder animateButtons(boolean animateButtons)
        Set whether or not the buttons fade out/in when changing visibilty
        Parameters:
        animateButtons - True to animate buttons, false to not
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • useCustomDoneButton

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder useCustomDoneButton(boolean useCustomDoneButton)
        Indicate that a done button is going to be provided in a custom fragment. Use WelcomeScreenFinisher.finish() in your button's onClickListener to close the welcome screen correctly.
        Parameters:
        useCustomDoneButton - Whether or not a done button will be present in the last fragment
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • showNextButton

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder showNextButton(boolean showNextButton)
        Set the visibility of the next button
        Parameters:
        showNextButton - Whether or not to show the next button
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • showPrevButton

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder showPrevButton(boolean showPrevButton)
        Sets the visibility of the previous button (navigates back through the pages). This shows in the same spot as the skip button. If this welcome screen can be skipped, setting this to true will hide the skip button on all but the first page.
        Parameters:
        showPrevButton - Whether or not to show the previous button
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • showActionBarBackButton

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder showActionBarBackButton(boolean showBackButton)
        If the action bar is enabled, setting this to true will cause the back button to be shown. Tapping it will cancel the welcome screen. (Show the action bar with a custom theme, set 'windowActionBar' to true and 'windowNoTitle' to false)
        Parameters:
        showBackButton - Whether or not to show the back button on the action bar
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

        Set the path to a typeface (in assets) to be used for the skip button
        Parameters:
        typefacePath - The path to a typeface file in assets folder
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • parallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder parallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                         int resId,
                                         String title,
                                         String description)
        Adds a page with a header and description that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        title - Text for the header TextView
        description - Text for the description TextView
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • parallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder parallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                         int resId,
                                         String title,
                                         String description,
                                         @ColorRes
                                         int colorResId)
        Adds a page with a header and description that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        title - Text for the header TextView
        description - Text for the description TextView
        colorResId - Color resource id to be used as the background color
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • parallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder parallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                         int resId,
                                         String title,
                                         String description,
                                         @ColorRes
                                         int colorResId,
                                         float startParallaxFactor,
                                         float endParallaxFactor)
        Adds a page with a header and description that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        title - Text for the header TextView
        description - Text for the description TextView
        colorResId - Color resource id to be used as the background color
        startParallaxFactor - The speed at which the first child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 0.2. A child with a factor of -1.0 will stay completely still, a child with a factor of 1.0 will move twice as fast.
        endParallaxFactor - The speed at which the last child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 1.0.
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • parallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder parallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                         int resId,
                                         String title,
                                         String description,
                                         @ColorRes
                                         int colorResId,
                                         float startParallaxFactor,
                                         float endParallaxFactor,
                                         String headerTypefacePath,
                                         String descriptionTypefacePath)
        Adds a page with a header and description that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        title - Text for the header TextView
        description - Text for the description TextView
        colorResId - Color resource id to be used as the background color
        startParallaxFactor - The speed at which the first child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 0.2. A child with a factor of -1.0 will stay completely still, a child with a factor of 1.0 will move twice as fast.
        endParallaxFactor - The speed at which the last child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 1.0.
        headerTypefacePath - The path to a typeface in assets to be used for the header
        descriptionTypefacePath - The path to a typeface in assets to be used for the description
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • fullScreenParallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder fullScreenParallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                                   int resId)
        Adds a page that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest. The default background color is used.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • fullScreenParallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder fullScreenParallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                                   int resId,
                                                   @ColorRes
                                                   int colorResId)
        Adds a page that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        colorResId - Color resource id to be used as the background color
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

      • fullScreenParallaxPage

        public WelcomeScreenBuilder fullScreenParallaxPage(@LayoutRes
                                                   int resId,
                                                   @ColorRes
                                                   int colorResId,
                                                   float startParallaxFactor,
                                                   float endParallaxFactor)
        Adds a page that applies a parallax effect to the supplied layout. The speed at which the children are moved is determined by their location in the layout, the first will move the slowest and the last will move the fastest.
        Parameters:
        resId - The layout resource id to apply the parallax effect to
        colorResId - Color resource id to be used as the background color
        startParallaxFactor - The speed at which the first child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 0.2. A child with a factor of -1.0 will stay completely still, a child with a factor of 1.0 will move twice as fast.
        endParallaxFactor - The speed at which the last child should move. Negative values for slower than normal, positive for faster. The default value is 1.0.
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained

        Adds a fragment, uses the default background color

        fragmentHolder - FragmentHolder that creates the fragment to add
        Returns:
        this WelcomeScreenBuilder object to allow method calls to be chained
